text.headline: Panther National
text.text:
Panther National is a private golf club in Palm Beach Gardens, Florida. The golf course is designed by Jack Nicklaus with Justin Thomas and is set on 200 acres of land with opening date in autumn 2023. The professional tees stretch past 8,000 yards. The topography has movement and elevation changes from almost 2 million cubic yards of earth being moved by Nicklaus team shapers to create the championship design.

Justin Thomas is a professional golfer on the PGA Tour who has also become a golf course architect. Thomas collaborated with Jack Nicklaus on his first design at Panther National adding insight into modern driving distance with input on the par 5 11th hole design strecthing back to 650+ yards and its strategic penalty area location. In 2021, Golf Magazine documented the details behind the final redesign of Nicklaus' best known golf course at Muirfield Village. From Taman Dayu in East Java, Indonesia to the Michlifen Resort & Country Club in the Atlas Mountains in Morroco, Jack Nicklaus is one of the most prolific golf course architects, designing over 425 courses in 45 countries. His design strategy/style is known for their beauty, challenge, and fairness.

An additional 9 hole short course has been constructed with a world class driving range practice facility where the best professional golfers in the world can train for upcoming events on the PGA Tour. The par 3 course has a hole inspired the island green 17th hole at TPC Sawgrass created by golf architect Pete Dye. Nicklaus' first introduction into golf architecture was with Pete Dye at Harbor Town in South Carolina.
